page.title: 01Swineshead, Location
page.content: Swineshead lies 12 miles north of Bedford, being formally part of Huntingdonshire. In 1888, it was transferred to Bedfordshire, the county to which it always geographically belonged. It is a small unspoilt village consisting mainly of old colour washed thatched and tiled cottages, dating between 17th and 19th centuries originally under the ownership of the Duchy of Manchester. Many of the cottages have been extended by widening the upper storey and enclosing this into a shallow pegged tile roof. Several of the houses were formally working farms. All have recently been renovated. The land around Swineshead is used for arable farming main crops being wheat, barley and rape, a more unusual crop is evening primrose.
